abstract: The road back for Nokia is going to be a long one, but many believe it will begin with the new smartphones bearing Microsoft's operating system to be introduced Wednesday.
snippet: The road back for Nokia is going to be a long one, but many believe it will begin with the new smartphones bearing Microsoft's operating system to be introduced Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN — When Stephen Elop, the chief executive of Nokia, introduces the company’s first phones bearing Microsoft Windows Phone software Wednesday, he will probably be met with equal parts good will and skepticism.

headline.main: Crucial Test for Nokia as Latest Smartphones Arrive
headline.print_headline: Nokia, a Fallen Leader, Risks a Lot in Introducing Phones With Windows Software
